intro: Centaurium corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered chickweed or purple top vervain, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
